text.Prompt:
Scotiabank has agreed to buy U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase's credit card portfolio in Canada, which includes the Sears Canada credit cards.

The bank announced the deal Thursday, but did not release financial terms.

Scotiabank is acquiring JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. It is Scotiabank's first foray into MasterCard in Canada.

It gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.

"This transaction is in line with our strategy to grow Scotiabank's payments business, including credit cards, while providing our shareholders with attractive risk adjusted returns," said James O'Sullivan, group head of Canadian banking at Scotiabank.

Troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card for the past year after JPMorgan announced it would terminate their agreement Nov. 15.

Scotiabank has rested part of its growth strategy on an expanded credit card business, partnering with Cineplex and buying 20 per cent of Canadian Tire's financial services business.

Generate a summary:
text.Response A: Scotiabank has announced the acquisition of JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. Scotiabank gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.
text.Response B: A Canadian bank has bought out a U.S. bank's credit card portfolio in Canada.  The bank didn't say how much money they paid, but it sounds like a lot.  The bank will also get call centres and security operations.  The bank also said it's going to get about 2 million credit card customers and a lot of money every year.  It's going to help the bank grow its business.  The retailer Sears Canada was looking for a new partner for its credit card after the other one said they were going to end their agreement.

meta.preamble_a: Respond in a cautious, defensive and uncertain way, as if you are unfamilar with the topic.
meta.preamble_b: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.

674.displayed_text:
Prompt

Scotiabank has agreed to buy U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase's credit card portfolio in Canada, which includes the Sears Canada credit cards.

The bank announced the deal Thursday, but did not release financial terms.

Scotiabank is acquiring JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. It is Scotiabank's first foray into MasterCard in Canada.

It gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.

"This transaction is in line with our strategy to grow Scotiabank's payments business, including credit cards, while providing our shareholders with attractive risk adjusted returns," said James O'Sullivan, group head of Canadian banking at Scotiabank.

Troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card for the past year after JPMorgan announced it would terminate their agreement Nov. 15.

Scotiabank has rested part of its growth strategy on an expanded credit card business, partnering with Cineplex and buying 20 per cent of Canadian Tire's financial services business.

Generate a summary:

Response A

Scotiabank has announced the acquisition of JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. Scotiabank gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.

Response B

A Canadian bank has bought out a U.S. bank's credit card portfolio in Canada. The bank didn't say how much money they paid, but it sounds like a lot. The bank will also get call centres and security operations. The bank also said it's going to get about 2 million credit card customers and a lot of money every year. It's going to help the bank grow its business. The retailer Sears Canada was looking for a new partner for its credit card after the other one said they were going to end their agreement.
